content:
Looking for a better error-image that can replace unloaded/broken images.
There are some folks working on design related stuff. Do you guys have any suggestion/idea?

@Sriram @Vaida Plankyte
What do you guys think?

going with the underwater theme, maybe something along the lines of a polaroid picture of a fish broken into half? Here's a mockup; sorry for the MS-Paint quality, I'm not on my work laptop. :p if you like this idea, i can make a proper drawing over the weekend. Screen-Shot-2017-03-23-at-10.09.13.png
The idea looks good. We would look to see a polished image. :)
That idea seems workable to me; would love some other folks' thoughts. BTW the thread here is errors images in general, not just emoji...

I guess how big do we want the broken image and broken emoji to be? That may determine the level of detail that we're allowed.
Another option for broken emoji is to replace it with :shortcode:, at least when it is in a message, though not sure if I like that better or worse.

broken image will definitely be the same size of inline image previews (100px height) because we don't want to have the layout of the message feed depend whether the images load (this is a super important performance thing). Same with emoji -- we want it to be the exact same size as the emoji.

For emoji: a dashed circle or square, with a question mark inside?
For image: We could also go with missing or unknown image, when thinking of designs, in addition to broken image.
Missing emoji is also most likely to be "deleted realm emoji" in reality
error.png maybe something like this?
This looks good. But maybe we could refine it a bit. What do you think?
I agree that the pixel art might not work with the more refined graphics!
will do a couple of versions of this before next weekend. do you have any preferences/ideas on what represents a broken image the best?
I personally think image of an aquatic animal broken from the bottom left side, and the zulip logo on its body
Maybe the bubbles can be replaced with Zulip logo
Yeah I'm thinking pixel art will feel out of place, but the concept should work fine
error2.PNG
reworked the pixelart into something more high rez!
@Raghav Jajodia ^
feel like it's a bit too bare-- maybe a quick handwritten 'zulip' like you'd have on polaroid pictures could be enough to make it better?
Yeah I think that'd be cool!
teddy.jpeg
I also think that would be better
Also consider making the background transparent

cool!
should the slice be on the right, to reference previous products' error images?
I also agree with somehow gray-ing out a bit (reducing the saturation?), so it feels like something "disabled".
Also what do you think of making the fish bigger, but making it's outline slightly thinner?
Those ideas all sound good to me :)
@Raghav Jajodia the background is transparent, just that I took a screengrab rather than exported the image
@Rishi Gupta very good points!! i'll reiterate over the weekend. :)
sorry this took forever! i made the changes @Rishabh Gupta suggested and i think it looks way better now! error3.svg

not sure why it doesn't show up-- here's a screengrab.
pasted image
cool, yeah, that's pretty good
@Raghav Jajodia @Rishabh Gupta let me know what you think! and what format this is needed in. :)

@Vaida Plankyte Yeah, looks good! This one works for me.
Although, I still feel that the background is white, not transparent. Do we need a white background?

@Rishi Gupta Thoughts?
Also, you might have tagged the wrong person.
Yeah, we should have a transparent background for the area outside the frame, so that if it's over a PM (or something else with a background color) it'll look right

The picture looks great! Though I'm not convinced people will see this and know what it is. Maybe we could go for something representing a picture frame instead? I.e. basically the same, but the inner rectangle goes to the bottom.

I also think it is still a bit too eye grabbing, because of the fish. Maybe having 2-3 smaller fish? If that's more than a few minutes of work though I think the single fish is still great.

Thanks @Vaida Plankyte!
I think that may just mean that we want it to have a "File not found" sort of label on it.
@Tim Abbott did you mean "fish not found"? should have all of @Rishabh Gupta 's good feedback implemented! error3.png
@Vaida Plankyte I think you mean @Rishi Gupta
ooops! :D
no worries :).
are there any other changes to this i should make?
I think this is just blocking on me to find time to code review
let me know if any changes to the design pop into your mind! :)
